The structured environment can help maintain focus and provide clear explanations that might be missed when working alone or using visual methods like mind maps.

Alternatively, consider using detailed textbooks and taking thorough written notes as your primary study method. This traditional approach can be very effective for subjects that require deep and rigorous understanding, like literature or chemistry. Additionally, annotated notes can provide a comprehensive review resource, enabling you to track your progress in a linear and organized manner.
